intro: Quinquina ovata, commonly known as the oval quinquina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its ovate-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. Quinquina ovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
